description.message: Browser syncing as it should be: secure, anonymous and free! Sync bookmarks across your browsers and devices, no sign up required.

login_GetSyncId_Message.message: Download the xBrowserSync desktop browser extension available for Chrome and Firefox, create a new sync and then scan your sync ID QR code on the previous screen.

login_introPanel1_Message.message:
Welcome

Thank you for choosing xBrowserSync! Before you begin, take some time to read through the following pages to get aquainted with xBrowserSync’s features. Futher information is available in the FAQs.

As xBrowserSync modifies your local browser data, we recommend you back up your bookmarks and disable any existing browser sync services to avoid conflicts.

login_introPanel2_Message.message:
Syncing for the first time

Before you can sync your browser data it must be encrypted so that only you can read it. Enter an encryption password — make it strong but also memorable, there are no resets or reminders so if you forget it you won’t be able to decrypt your synced data.

Once you click the Sync button your data will be encrypted and synced.

login_introPanel3_Message.message:
Already synced (got an ID)

When you create a new sync you are given a unique xBrowserSync ID which you can use along with your password to sync your data on other devices. Your anonymity is ensured as no personal data is collected or stored with your synced data.

Once synced you can view your ID in the Settings panel. Click it to reveal a handy QR code to scan when syncing on mobile devices.

login_introPanel4_Message.message:
Syncing to another service

By default your data is synced to the official xBrowserSync service, though anyone can run their own xBrowserSync service, either for private use (for ultimate security and privacy) or to make available for public use so that more people can enjoy xBrowserSync.

Check the available xBrowserSync services and switch services in the Settings panel.

login_introPanel5_Message.message:
New service, new ID

Your xBrowserSync ID will only work with the service on which it was created.

Whenever you change services you must create a new sync and then you’ll receive a new ID. You can move your existing synced data over from the old service by backing up on the old service and then restoring it once synced on the new service.

login_introPanel6_Message.message:
Searching your bookmarks

Once synced, simply press Enter to display your bookmarks in chronological order, or type some keywords or a URL in the search box to search your bookmarks.

Hover over a bookmark and click the pen icon to edit or delete the bookmark.

login_introPanel7_Message.message:
Adding a bookmark

Bookmark the current page by clicking on the bookmark icon in the Search panel. The bookmark’s properties will be populated for you, otherwise add a description and some tags to ensure better search results.

Alternatively, simply click the browser’s bookmark button as normal and xBrowserSync will automatically add the bookmark’s default properties.

login_introPanel8_Message.message:
Native features supported

Feel free to continue using your browser’s native bookmarking features, any changes you make will be synced automatically in the background.

If you have organised your existing bookmarks into folders don’t worry, xBrowserSync will respect and maintain your existing bookmarks hierarchy.

login_introPanel9_Message.message:
Remember to back up

When you use xBrowserSync your data is your reponsibility so be smart and make sure to take backups.

You can do this easily in the Settings panel, you can back up your unencrypted data to a local file which can then restored at a later date should you need to.

login_introPanel10_Message.message:
Shortcut xBrowserSync

To search your bookmarks quickly, assign a keyboard shortcut to activate the extension then just press Enter or start typing to search your bookmarks.

Browse to chrome://extensions/, the keyboard shortcuts option is at the bottom of the page.

login_introPanel11_Message.message:
Go mobile

Access your synced bookmarks on the move with the xBrowserSync Android app, available on Google Play store, F-Droid or direct download.

login_introPanel12_Message.message:
Noticed an issue?

If you’ve found a bug in xBrowserSync or would like to request a new feature, head on over to GitHub and submit an issue.

Calling all coders! If you would like to help make xBrowserSync better, go ahead and fork the xBrowserSync GitHub repo and submit a pull request.

login_ConfirmSync_Message.message: xBrowserSync will delete all local bookmarks data before restoring synced bookmarks. OK to proceed?

login_UpgradeSync_Message.message:
This sync ID must be upgraded in order to sync with this version of xBrowserSync. After upgrading, you will not be able to sync with previous versions of xBrowserSync.

Ensure you have updated all of your xBrowserSync apps before continuing. Ready to proceed?

login_Updated_Message.message: xBrowserSync has been updated with the latest features and fixes. For more details about the changes contained in this release, check out the release notes.

search_Field_Description.message: Start typing to find bookmarks or just hit Enter...

search_NoBookmarks_Message.message: You have no bookmarks, go add some!

settings_Sync_SyncToolbarConfirmation_Me.message:
Enabling syncing of the bookmarks bar will replace the bookmarks currently in the bookmarks bar with your synced bookmarks.

OK to proceed?

settings_Sync_ConfirmCancelSync_Message.message:
There is currently a sync in progress, if you proceed your local synced data will be incomplete.

OK to proceed?

settings_Sync_Id_Description.message: Use your ID to sync on other devices (click for QR code).

settings_Sync_UpdatesAvailable_False_Mes.message: Local sync data is up to date.

settings_Sync_UpdatesAvailable_True_Mess.message: Sync updates available, next sync at

settings_Sync_SyncToolbar_Description.message: Disable this setting if you wish to display local bookmarks in the bookmarks bar rather than synced bookmarks. Useful when syncing to multiple browsers.

settings_Service_ChangeService_Descripti.message: Switch to a different xBrowserSync service.

settings_BackupRestore_BackupLocal_Descr.message: Back up local browser data to a file.

settings_BackupRestore_BackupSynced_Desc.message: Back up synced data to a file.

settings_BackupRestore_RestoreLocal_Desc.message: Restore local browser data from a backup.

settings_BackupRestore_RestoreSynced_Des.message: Restore synced data from a backup.

settings_About_FAQs_Description.message: Got a question or having an issue? The answer might be in the FAQs.

settings_About_Issues_Description.message: Raise an issue to report a bug or request a new feature.

settings_About_Contributions_Description.message: If you enjoy using xBrowserSync and would like to support the project, consider becoming a patron.

settings_Service_UpdateForm_Message.message: Enter the URL of an alternative xBrowserSync service. Browse the list of public xBrowserSync services here.

settings_Service_UpdateForm_Confirm_Mess.message:
After changing the service, the current sync will be disabled and you'll need to create a new sync.

If you have previously created a sync using this service and would like to retrieve your data, you can use the xBrowserSync ID provided at the time.

OK to proceed?

settings_Service_UpdateForm_ServiceVersi.message: This service is running an unsupported API version

settings_BackupRestore_NotAvailable_Mess.message: Back up and restore will be available here once you are synced.

settings_BackupRestore_BackupSuccess_Mes.message: If the backup file does not download automatically, right click on the link below and 'Save link as...'.

settings_BackupRestore_RestoreForm_Messa.message: Copy the contents of a backup file to restore data.

settings_Sync_NotAvailable_Message.message: Sync settings will be available here once you are synced.

settings_Service_DataUsage_Description.message: How much of the sync data allowed by the service are you using.

settings_BackupRestore_ConfirmRestore_Sy.message:
As sync is currently enabled, the data being restored will overwrite your synced data.

To restore data to the local browser only, disable sync before restoring.

OK to proceed?

settings_BackupRestore_ConfirmRestore_No.message:
As sync is currently disabled, the data being restored will overwrite the local browser data.

OK to proceed?

connRestored_Message.message: Your xBrowserSync changes have been synced.

error_Default_Message.message: If this problem recurs, submit an issue at github.com/xbrowsersync/app.

error_HttpRequestFailed_Message.message: Couldn’t connect to the xBrowserSync service, check the service status in the Settings panel.

error_HttpRequestFailedWhileUpdating_Mes.message: Sync will be retried automatically when connection is restored.

error_TooManyRequests_Message.message: Too many requests sent, sync has been disabled. Re-enable sync to resume syncing.

error_RequestEntityTooLarge_Message.message: Unable to sync your data as it exceeds the size limit set by the xBrowserSync service. Remove some old bookmarks and try again or switch to a different xBrowserSync service that allows for larger syncs.

error_NotAcceptingNewSyncs_Message.message: Unable to sync as this xBrowserSync service is not currently accepting new syncs. If you have already created a sync using this service enter your xBrowserSync ID, or change to an alternative service.

error_DailyNewSyncLimitReached_Message.message: Unable to create new sync as you have reached your daily new sync limit for this xBrowserSync service. Sync with an existing xBrowserSync ID, choose a different service or try again tomorrow.

error_NoDataFound_Message.message: No sync exists for this ID. Double check your xBrowserSync ID and the service URL you are syncing to and try again.

error_IdRemoved_Message.message: Create a new ID and restore your data from a backup.

error_NoDataToRestore_Message.message: Ensure you have provided a valid xBrowserSync back up before restoring.

error_FailedGetLocalBookmarks_Message.message: An error occurred when trying to retrieve local bookmarks.

error_FailedCreateLocalBookmarks_Message.message: An error occurred when trying to create a local bookmark.

error_FailedRemoveLocalBookmarks_Message.message: An error occurred when trying to overwrite local bookmarks.

error_InvalidData_Message.message: Ensure your encryption password is identical to the one used when you created the sync for this ID.

error_LastChangeNotSynced_Message.message: The last change was not synced due to a bookmarks conflict. It would be a good idea to disable and re-enable sync before continuing.

error_BookmarkNotFound_Message.message: It looks like your bookmarks are out of sync. It would be a good idea to disable and re-enable sync before continuing.

error_OutOfSync_Message.message: Local data was out of sync but has now been refreshed. However, your last change was not synced so you will need to redo this change.

error_ApiInvalid_Message.message: The selected service URL is not pointing to a valid xBrowserSync service.

error_ApiVersionNotSupported_Message.message: This service is running an unsupported API version

error_ContainerChanged_Message.message: Changing, deleting or moving xBrowserSync folders can cause issues, sync has been disabled. Re-enable sync to restore bookmarks.

error_NotImplemented_Message.message: A required function has not been implemented and is causing xBrowserSync to not function correctly.

error_FailedGetPageMetadata_Message.message: URL is invalid or webpage data could not be retrieved.

error_SyncInterrupted_Message.message: A previous sync was interrupted and failed to complete. Re-enable sync to restore your synced data.
